arts.ttl: More Champions League joy for Sporting with 2-0 victory over Sturm Graz in Austria
arts.sum: Sporting put in another impressive performance to beat Sturm Graz 2-0 in Austria and make it two wins and one draw from three matches in the new format of the Champions League. Goals in either half from Nuno Santos and Viktor Gy√∂keres got the job done. The Portuguese champions could have scored more goals but were also thankful to goalkeeper Franco Israel for several sharp saves. Next up for Sporting in the competition are two home clashes against English heavyweights Manchester City and Arsenal. More to follow.

arts.ttl: Sturm Graz vs Sporting CP: Preview, predictions and lineups
arts.sum: Sporting CP travel to Austria on Tuesday night as they take on Sturm Graz on Matchday 3 of the Champions League league phase. Here is 90min's guide to Sturm Graz vs Sporting CP in the Champions League on Tuesday.
Aidan Perkins has cast his eye on all 18 Champions League games during Matchday Three this week and has a score prediction for each game.

arts.ttl: Sturm Graz vs Sporting Lisbon predictions: Third straight defeat likely for Austrians
arts.sum: Sturm Graz have lost both of their two Champions League fixtures this season and Dan Fitch does not expect their situation is likely to improve when they host an undefeated Sporting Lisbon side.

Sturm Graz bounced back from their 1-0 home loss to Club Bruges with impressive back-to-back home wins over Salzburg and Grazer AK, scoring 10 goals in the process. Sporting extended their unbeaten r...
